text: is a Japanese town in Nara Prefecture on the island of Honshū. The town has a population of 33,606 people. ==History== According to tradition, Kōryō was sometimes the site of an Imperial Palace,Koch, W. (1904). Japan; Geschichte nach japanischen Quellen und ethnographische Skizzen. Mit einem Stammbaum des Kaisers von Japan, p. 13. including * Umayasaka Palace or Umayasaka-no-miya, 640.Asuka Historical Museum, Palaces of the Asuka Period," 1995; retrieved 2012-5-3. * Kudara Palace or Kudara-no-miya, 640–642 Kudara is related to an ancient name of the Korean kingdom of Baekje.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kudara" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 569. ==Related pages== * Capital of Japan ==References== ==Other websites== * Kōryō website Category:Towns in Japan Category:Settlements in Nara Prefecture
title: Kōryō, Nara
